mi_connectors.name: AI

meta.name: AI
meta.description: The AI module allows you to integrate with AI services and develop AI applications.

operations.name: ragChat
operations.description: RAG Chat Completion

params.name: embeddingConfigKey
params.description: Embedding model connection to be used

params.name: vectorStoreConfigKey
params.description: Vector store connection to be used

params.name: llmConfigKey
params.description: LLM service connection to be used

params.name: memoryConfigKey
params.description: Memory connection to be used

params.name: sessionId
params.description: Provide a unique identifier for the session.

params.name: prompt
params.description: Query the LLM

params.name: embeddingModel
params.description: Select the splitting strategy Supported values: text-embedding-3-small, text-embedding-3-large, text-embedding-ada-002

params.name: maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to be returned

params.name: minScore
params.description: Minimum score to be considered as a valid result

params.name: modelName
params.description: Name of the model to use

params.name: outputType
params.description: Define type of the output Supported values: string, integer, float, boolean

params.name: maxHistory
params.description: Maximum chat history to use

params.name: system
params.description: Give instructions to LLM

params.name: maxTokens
params.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate

params.name: temperature
params.description: Controls randomness: lower temperature results in less randomness

params.name: topP
params.description: Controls diversity: lower value results in more diversity

params.name: frequencyPenalty
params.description: Controls repetition: lower value results in less repetition

params.name: seed
params.description: Seed

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: chat
operations.description: Chat Completion

params.name: llmConfigKey
params.description: Select the LLM service connection to be used for processing requests.

params.name: memoryConfigKey
params.description: Choose the memory connection to store and retrieve chat history.

params.name: modelName
params.description: Specify the name of the model to use for generating responses.

params.name: sessionId
params.description: Provide a unique identifier for the session.

params.name: prompt
params.description: Enter the query or prompt to send to the LLM for processing.

params.name: attachments
params.description: Attach additional data or context to enhance the LLM's response. The attachments should be in the format [{"type":"application/pdf", "content":"base64 content"}]. The supported types are: application/pdf, image/png, image/jpeg, text/plain, text/html, text/csv, text/xml. The content should be base64 encoded.

params.name: outputType
params.description: Select the data type for the output generated by the LLM. Supported values: string, integer, float, boolean

params.name: maxHistory
params.description: Set the maximum number of previous messages to include in the context.

params.name: system
params.description: Provide instructions or guidelines for the LLM to follow during the conversation.

params.name: maxTokens
params.description: Define the maximum number of tokens the LLM can generate in the response.

params.name: temperature
params.description: Adjust the randomness of the response: lower values produce more deterministic results.

params.name: topP
params.description: Control the diversity of the response: lower values result in more focused outputs.

params.name: frequencyPenalty
params.description: Reduce repetition in the response: higher values discourage repeated phrases.

params.name: seed
params.description: Set a seed value for deterministic outputs when randomness is involved.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: addToKnowledge
operations.description: Ingest documents to the vector store

params.name: vectorStoreConfigKey
params.description: Select the vector store connection to store and retrieve embeddings.

params.name: embeddingConfigKey
params.description: Choose the AI service connection for generating embeddings.

params.name: input
params.description: Provide the input data to be processed.

params.name: needParse
params.description: Enable this option if the input needs to be parsed into text.

params.name: parseType
params.description: Select the format of the input content to parse it correctly. Supported values: pdf-to-text, markdown-to-text, html-to-text, doc-to-text, docx-to-text, xls-to-text, xlsx-to-text, ppt-to-text, pptx-to-text

params.name: needSplit
params.description: Enable this option if the input needs to be split into smaller segments.

params.name: splitStrategy
params.description: Choose the strategy for splitting the input into segments. Supported values: Recursive, ByParagraph, BySentence

params.name: maxSegmentSize
params.description: Specify the maximum size (in tokens) for each segment.

params.name: maxOverlapSize
params.description: Specify the maximum overlap size (in tokens) between segments.

params.name: needEmbedding
params.description: Enable this option to generate embeddings for the input.

params.name: embeddingModel
params.description: Select the embedding model to generate vector representations. Supported values: text-embedding-3-small, text-embedding-3-small, text-embedding-ada-002

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: embeddingConfigKey

params.name: input
params.description: Provide the input text or query to search in the vector store.

params.name: needEmbedding
params.description: Check this box if the input needs to be embedded.

params.name: embeddingModel
params.description: Select the embedding model to use for processing the input. Supported values: text-embedding-3-small, text-embedding-3-small, text-embedding-ada-002

params.name: maxResults
params.description: Specify the maximum number of results to return.

params.name: minScore
params.description: Set the minimum score threshold for valid results.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: attachments
params.description: Attach additional data or context to enhance the LLM's response. The attachments should be in the format [{"type":"application/pdf", "content":"base64 content"}]. The supported types are: application/pdf, image/png, image/jpeg, text/plain, text/html, text/csv, text/xml. The content should be base64 encoded.

params.name: maxHistory
params.description: Set the maximum number of previous messages to include in the context.

params.name: maxTokens
params.description: Specify the maximum number of tokens to generate in the response.

params.name: temperature

params.name: topP
params.description: Control response diversity: lower values result in more focused outputs.

params.name: frequencyPenalty
params.description: Reduce repetition in responses: higher values discourage repeated phrases.

params.name: seed
params.description: Set a seed value for deterministic outputs (useful for debugging).

params.name: toolExecutionTimeout
params.description: Specify the maximum time (in seconds) allowed for tool execution.

meta.name: Amazon DynamoDB
meta.description: The Amazon DynamoDB connector allows you to access the Amazon DynamoDB REST API through the WSO2 ESB and perform CRUD operations. Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability.

operations.name: putItem
operations.description: Put Item

params.name: tableName
params.description: The name of the table to contain the item. Must be between 3 and 255 characters.

params.name: item
params.description: A map of attribute name/value pairs representing the item to create or replace. Each value must be a DynamoDB data type. Example: {"id":{"S":"123"},"name":{"S":"John"}}

params.name: conditionExpression
params.description: A condition that must be satisfied for the operation to succeed. The operation fails if the condition evaluates to false. Example: "attribute_not_exists(id)"

params.name: expected
params.description: A map of attribute/condition pairs. Cannot be used with ConditionExpression. Example: {"attr1":{"Value":{"S":"val1"},"ComparisonOperator":"EQ"}}

params.name: conditionalOperator
params.description: Logical operator to apply to conditions in the Expected map. Default is AND if not specified.

params.name: expressionAttributeNames
params.description: Name substitution tokens for attribute names in an expression. Maps placeholder names to actual attribute names. Example: {"#n":"name","#t":"timestamp"}

params.name: expressionAttributeValues
params.description: Value substitution tokens for expressions. Maps placeholder values to actual attribute values. Example: {":val1":{"S":"value1"},":val2":{"N":"123"}}

params.name: returnValues
params.description: Use NONE if you don't want item attributes returned, or ALL_OLD to get the item attributes as they appeared before they were modified.

params.name: returnConsumedCapacity
params.description: Determines the level of detail about provisioned throughput consumption to return. TOTAL returns consumption for table and indexes, INDEXES returns consumption for indexes, NONE returns nothing.

params.name: returnItemCollectionMetrics
params.description: Determines whether item collection metrics are returned. SIZE returns statistics about the item sizes, NONE returns no statistics.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: deleteItem
operations.description: Delete Item

params.name: tableName
params.description: The name of the table from which to delete the item. Must be between 3 and 255 characters.

params.name: key
params.description: Primary key attribute values for the item to delete. Must be a JSON object where keys are attribute names and values are attribute values in DynamoDB format. Example: {"id":{"S":"123"}}

params.name: conditionExpression
params.description: A condition that must be satisfied for the operation to succeed. The delete operation only succeeds if the condition evaluates to true. Example: "attribute_exists(#status)"

params.name: expected
params.description: A map of attribute/condition pairs. Cannot be used with ConditionExpression. Example: {"attr1":{"Value":{"S":"val1"},"ComparisonOperator":"EQ"}}

params.name: conditionalOperator
params.description: Logical operator to apply to conditions in the Expected map. Default is AND if not specified.

params.name: expressionAttributeNames
params.description: Name substitution tokens for attribute names in an expression. Maps placeholder names to actual attribute names. Example: {"#n":"name","#t":"timestamp"}

params.name: expressionAttributeValues
params.description: Value substitution tokens for expressions. Maps placeholder values to actual attribute values. Example: {":val1":{"S":"value1"},":val2":{"N":"123"}}

params.name: returnValues
params.description: Use NONE if you don't want item attributes returned, or ALL_OLD to get the item attributes as they appeared before they were deleted.

params.name: returnConsumedCapacity
params.description: Determines the level of detail about provisioned throughput consumption to return. TOTAL returns consumption for table and indexes, INDEXES returns consumption for indexes, NONE returns nothing.

params.name: returnItemCollectionMetrics
params.description: Determines whether item collection metrics are returned. SIZE returns statistics about the item sizes, NONE returns no statistics.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: getItem
operations.description: Get Item

params.name: tableName
params.description: The name of the table containing the requested item. Must be between 3 and 255 characters.

params.name: key
params.description: Primary key attribute values for the item. Must be a JSON object where keys are attribute names and values are attribute values in DynamoDB format. Example: {"id":{"S":"123"}}

params.name: attributesToGet
params.description: List of one or more attributes to retrieve from the table. If not provided, then all attributes will be returned. Cannot be used with ProjectionExpression. Example: ["attr1","attr2"]

params.name: projectionExpression
params.description: String that identifies the attributes to retrieve from the table. Cannot be used with AttributesToGet. Example: "attr1, attr2.nestedAttr"

params.name: consistentRead
params.description: Determines the read consistency model. If set to true, the operation uses strongly consistent reads; otherwise, the operation uses eventually consistent reads.

params.name: expressionAttributeNames
params.description: Name substitution tokens for attribute names in an expression. Maps placeholder names to actual attribute names. Example: {"#n":"name","#t":"timestamp"}

params.name: returnConsumedCapacity
params.description: Determines the level of detail about provisioned throughput consumption to return. TOTAL returns consumption for table and indexes, INDEXES returns consumption for indexes, NONE returns nothing.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: scan
operations.description: Scan

params.name: tableName
params.description: The name of the table to scan. Must be between 3 and 255 characters.

params.name: indexName
params.description: The name of a secondary index to scan. This can be any local secondary index or global secondary index on the table.

params.name: filterExpression
params.description: A string that contains conditions that DynamoDB applies after the scan operation, but before the data is returned. Items that do not satisfy the criteria are not returned. Example: "#status = :val"

params.name: scanFilter
params.description: Legacy parameter for filtering. Use FilterExpression instead. Optional parameter

params.name: conditionalOperator
params.description: Logical operator to apply to the conditions in ScanFilter. Optional parameter

params.name: projectionExpression
params.description: String that identifies one or more attributes to retrieve from the table. Optional parameter

params.name: attributesToGet
params.description: Legacy parameter for attribute selection. Use ProjectionExpression instead. Optional parameter

params.name: select
params.description: Attributes to be returned in the result. Optional parameter

params.name: expressionAttributeNames
params.description: One or more substitution tokens for attribute names in an expression. Optional parameter

params.name: expressionAttributeValues
params.description: One or more values that can be substituted in an expression. Optional parameter

params.name: limit
params.description: Maximum number of items to evaluate (not necessarily returned). Optional parameter

params.name: exclusiveStartKey
params.description: Primary key of the first item that this operation will evaluate. Optional parameter

params.name: segment
params.description: Individual segment to be scanned by an application worker (for parallel scan). Optional parameter

params.name: totalSegments
params.description: Total number of segments into which the scan operation will be divided. Optional parameter

params.name: consistentRead
params.description: Determines the read consistency model during the scan. Optional parameter

params.name: returnConsumedCapacity
params.description: Determines the level of detail about provisioned throughput consumption. Optional parameter

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: updateItem
operations.description: Update Item

params.name: tableName
params.description: The name of the table containing the item to update. Must be between 3 and 255 characters.

params.name: key
params.description: Primary key attribute values for the item to update. Must be a JSON object where keys are attribute names and values are attribute values in DynamoDB format. Example: {"id":{"S":"123"}}

params.name: updateExpression
params.description: An expression that defines one or more attributes to be updated, the action to be performed on them, and new values for them. Example: "SET #name = :val1, #status = :val2"

params.name: attributeUpdates
params.description: Map of attribute names and their corresponding actions to perform. Cannot be used with UpdateExpression. Example: {"attr1":{"Action":"PUT","Value":{"S":"newValue"}}}

params.name: conditionExpression
params.description: A condition that must be satisfied for the operation to succeed. The update operation only succeeds if the condition evaluates to true. Example: "attribute_exists(#status)"

params.name: expected
params.description: JSON map of attribute/condition pairs for conditional operations. Optional parameter

params.name: conditionalOperator
params.description: Logical operator to apply to conditions in the expected map. Optional parameter

params.name: expressionAttributeNames
params.description: JSON map for substitution tokens for attribute names. Format: {"#name":"ActualAttributeName"}. Optional parameter

params.name: expressionAttributeValues
params.description: JSON map for substitution values in expressions. Format: {":val":{"S":"value"}}. Optional parameter

params.name: returnValues
params.description: Use to get item attributes as they appeared before/after the update. Optional parameter

params.name: returnConsumedCapacity
params.description: Determines the level of detail about provisioned throughput consumption. Optional parameter

params.name: returnItemCollectionMetrics
params.description: Determines whether item collection metrics are returned. Optional parameter

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: createTable
operations.description: Create Table

params.name: tableName
params.description: The name of the table to create. Must be between 3 and 255 characters and unique for your AWS account in the current region.

params.name: attributeDefinitions
params.description: Array of attributes that describe the key schema for the table and indexes. Each element describes one attribute. Example: [{"AttributeName":"id","AttributeType":"S"},{"AttributeName":"timestamp","AttributeType":"N"}]

params.name: keySchema
params.description: Specifies the attributes that make up the primary key for the table. Must include one HASH (partition key) and optionally one RANGE (sort key). Example: [{"AttributeName":"id","KeyType":"HASH"},{"AttributeName":"timestamp","KeyType":"RANGE"}]

params.name: provisionedThroughput
params.description: The provisioned throughput settings for the table. Defines the maximum number of reads and writes per second. Example: {"ReadCapacityUnits":5,"WriteCapacityUnits":5}

params.name: localSecondaryIndexes
params.description: JSON array of local secondary indexes (maximum: 5). Optional parameter

params.name: globalSecondaryIndexes
params.description: JSON array of global secondary indexes (maximum: 5). Optional parameter

params.name: StreamSpecification
params.description: Settings for DynamoDB Streams on the table. Optional parameter

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: indexName
params.description: The name of a secondary index to query. This can be a global secondary index (GSI) or a local secondary index (LSI).

params.name: keyConditionExpression
params.description: Condition that specifies the key values for items to be retrieved. Must specify the partition key value and can optionally specify the sort key value. Example: "id = :id AND #timestamp > :start"

params.name: keyConditions
params.description: Legacy parameter for key conditions. Use KeyConditionExpression instead. Optional parameter

params.name: filterExpression
params.description: String that contains conditions that DynamoDB applies after the Query operation. Optional parameter

params.name: queryFilter
params.description: Legacy parameter for filtering. Use FilterExpression instead. Optional parameter

params.name: conditionalOperator
params.description: Logical operator to apply to the conditions in QueryFilter. Optional parameter

params.name: projectionExpression

params.name: attributesToGet
params.description: Legacy parameter for attributes to get. Use ProjectionExpression instead. Optional parameter

params.name: select
params.description: Attributes to be returned in the result. Optional parameter

params.name: limit

params.name: exclusiveStartKey

params.name: consistentRead

params.name: expressionAttributeNames

params.name: expressionAttributeValues

params.name: region
params.description: The AWS region where your DynamoDB resources are located. Example: us-east-1, us-west-2, eu-west-1

params.name: accessKeyId
params.description: The AWS access key ID that corresponds to the secret access key. Used to sign requests to AWS services.

params.name: secretAccessKey
params.description: The AWS secret access key associated with your AWS account. Keep this secure and never share it publicly.

params.name: blocking
params.description: Whether to perform blocking invocations to Amazon DynamoDB. When true, the operation waits for a response before proceeding.

meta.name: Amazon Lambda
meta.description: The AmazonLambda Connector allows you to access the REST API of Amazon Web Service Lambda (AWS Lambda) , which lets you run code without provisioning or managing servers. With Lambda, you can run code for virtually any type of application or backend service - all with zero administration. Just upload your code in one of the languages that AWS Lambda supports (currently Node.js, Java, C#, Go and Python) and Lambda takes care of everything required to run and scale your code with high availability.

meta.name: Amazon S3
meta.description: The Amazon S3 connector allows you to access the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3), which provides a simple web services interface that can be used to store and retrieve any amount of data, at any time, from anywhere on the web. It gives any developer access to the same highly scalable, reliable, secure, fast, inexpensive infrastructure that Amazon S3 uses to run its own global network of websites. The connector with WSO2 EI enables you to publish and manage your enterprise data at Amazon S3 service.

params.description: The set of AWS accounts or groups are granted access and the type of access. Supported values: private, public-read, public-read-write, authenticated-read, aws-exec-read, bucket-owner-read, bucket-owner-full-control

params.name: cacheControl
params.description: This can be used to specify caching behavior along the request or reply chain.

params.name: contentDisposition
params.description: This specifies presentational information for the object.

params.name: contentEncoding
params.description: This specifies what content encodings have been applied to the object.

params.name: contentLanguage
params.description: The language the content is in.

params.name: contentType
params.description: A standard MIME type describing the format of the object data.

params.name: copySourceIfMatch
params.description: The object will be copied if its entity tag (ETag) matches this.

params.name: copySourceIfModifiedSince
params.description: The object will be copied if it has been modified since the specified time.

params.name: copySourceIfNoneMatch
params.description: The object will be copied if its entity tag (ETag) is different than the specified ETag.

params.name: copySourceIfUnmodifiedSince
params.description: The object will be copied if it hasn't been modified since the specified time.

params.name: expires
params.description: The date and time at which the object is no longer cacheable.

params.name: grantFullControl
params.description: The comma separated type(id, uri, emailAddress)=value pair to grant READ, READ_ACP, and WRITE_ACP permissions on the object.

params.name: grantRead
params.description: The comma separated type(id, uri, emailAddress)=value pair to grant READ objects permission to those accounts.

params.name: grantReadACP
params.description: The comma separated type(id, uri, emailAddress)=value pair to grant READ_ACP objects permission to those accounts.

params.name: grantWriteACP
params.description: The comma separated type(id, uri, emailAddress)=value pair to grant WRITE_ACP objects permission to those accounts.

params.name: metadataDirective
params.description: Specify whether the metadata is copied from the source object or replaced with metadata provided in the request. Supported values: COPY, REPLACE

params.name: metadata
params.description: New metadata to be replaced. Comma separated key value pair. The key and value are separated by ':'. Supported values: COPY, REPLACE

params.name: taggingDirective
params.description: Specifies whether the object tag-set are copied from the source object or replaced with tag-set provided in the request. Supported values: COPY, REPLACE

params.name: serverSideEncryption
params.description: The server-side encryption algorithm used for storing the object.

params.name: storageClass
params.description: The storage class. Supported values: STANDARD, REDUCED_REDUNDANCY, STANDARD_IA, ONEZONE_IA, INTELLIGENT_TIERING, GLACIER, DEEP_ARCHIVE, OUTPOSTS

params.name: websiteRedirectLocation
params.description: The redirect URL of the object if the bucket is configured as a website.

params.name: sseCustomerAlgorithm
params.description: The algorithm to use to when encrypting the object.

params.name: sseCustomerKey
params.description: The customer-provided encryption key to use in encrypting data.

params.name: sseCustomerKeyMD5
params.description: The 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321.

params.name: ssekmsKeyId
params.description: The ID of the symmetric customer managed AWS KMS CMK to use for object encryption.

params.name: ssekmsEncryptionContext
params.description: The AWS KMS Encryption Context to use for object encryption.

params.name: copySourceSSECustomerAlgorithm
params.description: The algorithm to use when decrypting the source object.

params.name: copySourceSSECustomerKey
params.description: The customer-provided encryption key for Amazon S3 to use to decrypt the source object.

params.name: copySourceSSECustomerKeyMD5
params.description: The 128-bit MD5 digest of the encryption key according to RFC 1321.

params.name: requestPayer
params.description: Confirms that this requester knows that they will be charged for the request. Bucket owners need not specify this parameter in their requests. Supported values: requester

params.name: tagging
params.description: The tag-set for the destination object. The tag-set must be encoded as URL Query parameters. (For example, Key1=Value1). This must be used in conjunction with the TaggingDirective.

params.name: objectLockMode
params.description: The object Lock mode that you want to apply to the uploaded object. Supported values: GOVERNANCE, COMPLIANCE

params.name: objectLockRetainUntilDate
params.description: The date and time when you want the Object Lock to expire.

params.name: objectLockLegalHoldStatus

params.name: destinationBucket
params.description: The destination bucket where the object will be copied.

params.name: destinationKey
params.description: The name for the object to create after copying.

params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

meta.name: Amazon Simple Queue Service
meta.description: Amazon SQS offers reliable and scalable hosted queues for storing messages as they travel between computers. By using Amazon SQS, you can move data between distributed components of your applications that perform different tasks without losing messages or requiring each component to be always available. The Amazon SQS connector for WSO2 EI uses the Amazon SQS API and allows you to send and receive messages, facilitating asynchronous messaging between integrated systems.

meta.name: Amazon Simple Queue Service (Inbound)
meta.description: Amazon SQS offers reliable and scalable hosted queues for storing messages as they travel between computers. By using Amazon SQS, you can move data between distributed components of your applications that perform different tasks without losing messages or requiring each component to be always available.

operations.name: init
operations.description: Initialize Kafka Inbound Endpoint

params.name: suspend

params.description: Provide the AWS secret key for authentication. Not required if IAM Role authentication is used.

params.description: The duration (in seconds) the call waits for a message to arrive in the queue before returning.

params.name: maxNoOfMessage

params.name: autoRemoveMessage
params.description: Automatically remove the message from the queue after processing.

params.name: attributeNames
params.description: Specify which message attribute names to retrieve.

meta.name: AS400 PCML
meta.description: The AS400 PCML connector allows you to access RPG programs that are available on AS400 (renamed as IBM iSeries) servers using WSO2 ESB. This is done using Program Call Markup Language (PCML). The AS400 is a mid-range server used by small businesses and departments in large enterprises and has been re-designed to work with web applications in a distributed network.

operations.name: init

operations.description: Calls a program in the AS400 system.

operations.name: trace
operations.description: Modify trace log levels.

operations.name: returnPool
operations.description: Returns the AS400 connection to the connection pool.

mi_connectors.name: Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2
mi_connectors.description: The Azure Data Lake Connector allows WSO2 Micro Integrator to interact with Azure Data Lake Storage, enabling integration with cloud-based big data solutions. It provides operations for file handling, data retrieval, and metadata management, making it easier to work with structured and unstructured data in Azure's cloud ecosystem.

mi_connectors.name: CDC (Inbound)
mi_connectors.description: The CDC inbound endpoint is used to perform Change Data Capture in MI.

meta.name: CDC (Inbound)
meta.description: The CDC inbound protocol is used to perform Change Data Capture in MI. The changes happening to any external database can be listened to using the CDC inbound endpoint. The CDC protocol uses Debezium to connect with the databases and capture the events. The protocol itself outputs the event via a sequence through the Inbound Endpoint.

operations.name: init
operations.description: Initialize Kafka Inbound Endpoint

params.name: name
params.description: Unique identifier for the CDC event integration.

params.name: sequence
params.description: Sequence to inject the CDC message

params.name: onError
params.description: Error sequence to invoke on fault

params.name: interval
params.description: The polling interval for the CDC inbound endpoint.

params.name: sequential
params.description: The behavior when executing the given sequence.

params.name: coordination
params.description: In a clustered setup, this will run the inbound only in a single worker node.

params.name: suspend
params.description: Enable this option to suspend the inbound endpoint immediately after deployment.

params.name: preserve.event
params.description: Enable this to preserve the original event payload.

params.name: snapshot.mode
params.description: Specifies the criteria for running a snapshot when the connector starts.

params.name: connector.class
params.description: The name of the Java class for the connector.

params.name: database.hostname
params.description: IP address or hostname of the database server.

params.name: database.port
params.description: Port number (Integer) of the database server.

params.name: database.user
params.description: Name of the database user to use when connecting to the database server.

params.name: database.password
params.description: The password to connect to the database.

params.name: database.dbname
params.description: The name of the database that needs to be listened to.

params.name: database.instance
params.description: Specifies the instance name of the SQL Server named instance.

params.name: database.names
params.description: The comma-separated list of the SQL Server database names from which to stream the changes.

params.name: database.server.id
params.description: A unique numeric ID for this database client across all active database processes in the cluster.

params.name: table.include.list
params.description: Comma-separated list of tables for which changes need to be captured.

params.name: allowed.operations
params.description: Comma separated values. Ex: create, update, delete, truncate.

params.name: connector.name
params.description: Unique name for the Debezium connector instance. The inbound endpoint name is used as default.

params.name: topic.prefix
params.description: The prefix, used for all Kafka topic names, must be unique across all connectors.

params.name: schema.history.internal
params.description: The Java class that persists the database schema history.

params.name: schema.history.internal.file.filename
params.description: Specify the file path where the database schema history is stored.

params.name: schema.history.internal.kafka.topic
params.description: The Kafka topic storing the database schema history.

params.name: schema.history.internal.kafka.bootstrap.servers
params.description: The initial list of Kafka cluster servers to connect.

params.name: offset.storage
params.description: The Java class that persists connector offsets.

params.name: offset.storage.file.filename
params.description: Path to file where offsets are to be stored.

params.name: offset.storage.topic
params.description: The Kafka topic where offsets are stored.

params.name: offset.storage.partitions
params.description: The number of partitions for the offset storage topic.

params.name: offset.storage.replication.factor
params.description: The replication factor for the offset storage topic.

params.name: database.out.server.name
params.description: The name of the XStream outbound server configured in the database.

operations.name: getAListOfDocuments
operations.description: This request allows to retrieve the list of documents attached to an employee. The response includes the document GUID used to retrieve contents with Get Document Details REST API

operations.name: getAvailability
operations.description: Availabilty represents the periods an employee is available to be scheduled for work. This request allows you to retrieve a single employee's daily availability between two dates. In order to use it, an employee XRefCodes is needed. Employee XRefCodes can be retrieved with GET Employees REST API

operations.name: getSchedules
operations.description: Retrieve the configured schedules for a single employee for every day within a defined period. In order to use this request, an employee XRefCodes is needed. Employee XRefCodes can be retrieved with GET Employees REST API

operations.name: getTimeAwayFromWork
operations.description: Retrieve the scheduled time away from work (TAFW) periods of a single employee. In order to use this request, an employee XRefCodes is needed. Employee XRefCodes can be retrieved with GET Employees REST API

operations.name: getEmployeePunches
operations.description: Extract the worked shift data for several employees at a time. Required parameters for the call include FilterTransactionStartTimeUTC and FilterTransactionEndTimeUTC. The system will search for all employee punch records that were modified between these two dates. The two dates must be 7 days apart or less. REST API

operations.name: getEmployeeRawPunches
operations.description: Retrieve raw punches as they are entered at the clock REST API

operations.name: postEmployeeRawPunches
operations.description: Insert a raw punch. This raw punch record will be treated as a punch coming from the clock and be validated against configured punch policies REST API

operations.name: getJobPostings
operations.description: Availabilty represents the periods an employee is available to be scheduled for work. This request allows you to retrieve a single employee's daily availability between two dates. In order to use it, an employee XRefCodes is needed. Employee XRefCodes can be retrieved with GET Employees REST API

mi_connectors.name: Creatio
mi_connectors.description: Git repository for the Creatio connector

meta.name: Creatio
meta.description: The Creatio Connector allows you to work with almost all the entities and functionalities of Creatio through REST interface, a web-based service that allows organisations to manage Customer Relationship Management (CRM) data while integration with external services/applications. You can use the Creatio connector to create, query, retrieve, update, and delete any of the objects that are exposed through the Creatio REST API layer by adding the authentication. It contains Contact, Case and Account mediators to manage CRUD operations through REST APIs. The Creatio Connector was contributed by Mitra Innovation.

meta.name: CSV
meta.description: CSV Module provides the capability to transform CSV payloads into JSON and XML and provides tools to transform CSV payload format.

operations.name: csvToXml
operations.description: CSV to XML

params.name: description
params.description: Component description

params.name: headerPresent
params.description: Is there a header in the CSV payload ? Default is Absent Supported values: Present, Absent

params.name: valueSeparator
params.description: Specify a value separator for CSV. Default is comma ( , )

params.name: skipHeader
params.description: Skip header from the content. Default is False

params.name: columnsToSkip
params.description: Comma separated string of column indexes to skip. Leave blank to skip no columns

params.name: dataRowsToSkip
params.description: Number of data rows to skip. Default is 0

params.name: tagNames
params.description: Comma separated string of tag names for result XML

params.name: rootElementTag
params.description: Tag name of the root XML element

params.name: rootElementNamespace
params.description: Namespace URI for root XML element

params.name: rootElementNamespaceURI
params.description: Namespace prefix for root XML element

params.name: groupElementTag
params.description: Name of the group xml elements

params.name: groupElementNamespace
params.description: Namespace URI for group XML element

params.name: groupElementNamespaceURI
params.description: Namespace prefix group XML element

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: csvToJson
operations.description: CSV to Json

params.name: description
params.description: Component description

params.name: headerPresent
params.description: Is there a header in the CSV payload ? Default is Absent Supported values: Present, Absent

params.description: Specify a value separator for CSV. Default is comma ( , )

params.description: Treat empty CSV values as null or empty strings. Default is to consider as null Supported values: Null, Empty

params.name: jsonKeys
params.description: Comma separated keys to use in the JSON object. Using the CSV header or auto generated keys if not specified

params.name: dataTypes
params.description: Specify data types as comma separated values. Supporting: string,integer,number,boolean

params.name: rootJsonKey
params.description: Key for embedding JSON object. Leave blank to get the original result

params.description: Order columns ascending or descending. Default is ascending Supported values: Ascending, Descending

params.name: columnsToSkip

meta.description: The FHIR Repository Connector allows you to connect to a FHIR repository/store and perform standard FHIR interactions.

operations.description: Init configuration for FHIR repository connector.

operations.name: batch

operations.name: connect

meta.name: File
meta.description: The File connector allows you to connect to Local and remote (using protocols FTP, FTPS, SFTP) file systems and perform file related operations. The file connector uses the Apache Commons VFS I/O functionalities to execute operations. (Note: You need to have U2 updated versions after 25 th JUL 2023 up to MI-1.2.0 to MI-4.2.0)

operations.name: checkExist
operations.description: Check Existence of a File or Directory

params.name: path
params.description: Path to zip file to extract

params.name: diskShareAccessMask
params.description: Comma separated access mask values for disk share. This is only applicable for SMB2 connection type.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: createDirectory
operations.description: Create Directory

params.name: directoryPath
params.description: Path to new directory.

params.name: autoCreate
params.description: Automatically create missing parent directories if they don't exist.

params.name: permissions
params.description: Permissions to set on the new directory in octal format. Common values: 700 (Read/Write/Execute - Owner Only), 755 (Read/Write/Execute - Owner, Read/Execute - Others), 750 (Read/Write/Execute - Owner, Read/Execute - Group), 644 (Read/Write - Owner, Read Only - Others). Mainly supported for local file systems. Supported values: 700, 755, 750, 644, 640, 600, 777, 770

params.name: diskShareAccessMask
params.description: Comma separated access mask values for disk share. This is only applicable for SMB2 connection type.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: compress
operations.description: Archives a File or a Directory

params.name: sourceDirectoryPath
params.description: Path to file/folder to compress

params.name: targetFilePath
params.description: Path to the Zip file to create.

params.name: includeSubDirectories
params.description: Whether to include sub-directories when compressing.

params.name: fileFilterType
params.description: Type of file filtering pattern: 'ant' for Ant-style patterns or 'regex' for regular expressions Supported values: ant, regex

params.name: includeFiles
params.description: Comma-separated patterns for files to include (e.g., '*.txt,*.csv' for Ant-style or '.*\.(txt|csv)' for regex)

params.name: excludeFiles
params.description: Comma-separated patterns for files to exclude (e.g., '*.tmp,*.log' for Ant-style or '.*\.(tmp|log)' for regex)

params.name: maxFileAge
params.description: Maximum age of files to include (e.g., '7d', '2h', '30m', '60s'). Files older than this will be excluded. Supports units: s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days).

params.name: subDirectoryMaxDepth
params.description: Maximum depth of subdirectories to traverse when includeSubDirectories is true (e.g., '3' for 3 levels deep)

params.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
params.description: Time to wait between file size checks to ensure file stability in milliseconds (e.g., '2000', '5000'). Prevents processing files still being written.

params.name: diskShareAccessMask
params.description: Comma separated access mask values for disk share. This is only applicable for SMB2 connection type.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: copy
operations.description: Copies the File or Folder Specified by SourcePath into TargetPath

params.name: sourcePath
params.description: The path to the file to be copied.

params.name: targetPath
params.description: The target directory where to copy the file.

params.name: sourceFilePattern
params.description: The pattern (regex) of the files to be copied. (e.g., [a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z]*.(txt|xml|jar)). Note: Use fileFilterType for advanced filtering.

params.name: fileFilterType
params.description: Type of pattern matching: 'ant' for Ant-style patterns (e.g., *.txt, **/*.java) or 'regex' for regular expressions. Supported values: ant, regex

params.name: includeFiles
params.description: Comma-separated patterns for files to include. Uses fileFilterType pattern matching (e.g., '*.txt,*.pdf' for Ant or '.*\.txt$,.*\.pdf$' for regex).

params.name: excludeFiles
params.description: Comma-separated patterns for files to exclude. Uses fileFilterType pattern matching. Exclude patterns take precedence over include patterns.

params.name: maxFileAge
params.description: Maximum age of files to copy (e.g., '2h', '30m', '1d'). Supports units: s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days).

params.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
params.description: Time in milliseconds to wait between size checks for file stability verification. Ensures files are not actively being written before copying.

params.name: includeParent
params.description: Whether to copy including parent folder of the source folder or only content inside.

params.name: overwrite
params.description: Whether or not to overwrite the file if the target destination already exists.

params.name: renameTo
params.description: The new name for the copied file. If not provided, the original file name is kept.

params.name: maxRetries
params.description: The maximum number of retries to be done in case of a failure.

params.name: retryDelay
params.description: The time interval between retries in milliseconds.

params.name: diskShareAccessMask
params.description: Comma separated access mask values for disk share. This is only applicable for SMB2 connection type.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: listFiles
operations.description: List Files In Directory

params.name: directoryPath
params.description: Path to directory to list files in.

params.name: matchingPattern
params.description: Legacy file pattern to match when listing (use Include Files for new implementations)

params.name: fileFilterType
params.description: Type of file filtering: 'regex' for regular expressions or 'ant' for Ant-style patterns Supported values: regex, ant

params.name: includeFiles
params.description: Pattern for files to include. Ant style: '*.txt,*.csv' or Regex: '.*\.(txt|csv)'

params.name: excludeFiles
params.description: Pattern for files to exclude. Ant style: '*.xml,*.log' or Regex: '.*\.(xml|log)'

params.name: maxFileAge
params.description: Maximum age of files to include (e.g., '7d', '2h', '30m', '60s'). Supports units: s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days).

params.name: recursive
params.description: List files in sub-directories

params.name: subDirectoryMaxDepth
params.description: Maximum depth of subdirectories to search when recursive is enabled. Leave empty for unlimited depth.

params.name: responseFormat
params.description: Response will be formatted as per this attribute. Supported values: Hierarchical, Flat

params.name: sortingAttribute
params.description: Files will be listed as per attribute. Supported values: Name, Size, LastModifiedTime

params.name: sortingOrder
params.description: Order you need to sort in ascending or descending order Supported values: Ascending, Descending

params.name: maxRetries
params.description: The maximum number of retries to be done in case of a failure.

params.name: retryDelay
params.description: The time interval between retries in milliseconds.

params.name: diskShareAccessMask
params.description: Comma separated access mask values for disk share. This is only applicable for SMB2 connection type.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: targetFilePath
params.description: Path to create merged file. If already exists, it will get overwritten.

params.name: filePattern
params.description: Pattern of files include in merging. Note: Use fileFilterType for advanced filtering.

params.name: fileFilterType
params.description: Type of pattern matching: 'ant' for Ant-style patterns (e.g., *.txt, **/*.java) or 'regex' for regular expressions. Supported values: ant, regex

params.name: includeFiles
params.description: Comma-separated patterns for files to include. Uses fileFilterType pattern matching (e.g., '*.txt,*.pdf' for Ant or '.*\.txt$,.*\.pdf$' for regex).

params.name: excludeFiles
params.description: Comma-separated patterns for files to exclude. Uses fileFilterType pattern matching. Exclude patterns take precedence over include patterns.

params.name: maxFileAge
params.description: Maximum age of files to merge (e.g., '2h', '30m', '1d'). Supports units: s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days).

params.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
params.description: Time in milliseconds to wait between size checks for file stability verification. Ensures files are not actively being written before merging.

params.name: writeMode
params.description: Pattern of files include in merging. Supported values: Overwrite, Append

params.name: diskShareAccessMask
params.description: Comma separated access mask values for disk share. This is only applicable for SMB2 connection type.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: delete

params.description: Path to file or directory to delete.

params.name: matchingPattern
params.description: Legacy pattern (regex) to match file name. Use Include Files for new implementations.

params.name: fileFilterType
params.description: Type of file filtering: 'regex' for regular expressions or 'ant' for Ant-style patterns Supported values: regex, ant

params.name: includeFiles
params.description: Pattern for files to include in deletion. Ant style: '*.txt,*.csv' or Regex: '.*\.(txt|csv)'

params.name: excludeFiles
params.description: Pattern for files to exclude from deletion. Ant style: '*.xml,*.log' or Regex: '.*\.(xml|log)'

params.name: maxFileAge
params.description: Maximum age of files to include in deletion (e.g., '7d', '2h', '30m', '60s'). Supports units: s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days).

params.name: maxRetries
params.description: The maximum number of retries to be done in case of a failure.

params.name: retryDelay

params.name: diskShareAccessMask

params.name: responseVariable

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: write
operations.description: create file and writes the content

params.name: filePath
params.description: Path of the file to be written.

params.name: contentOrExpression
params.description: Static content or expression to receive content. If not given what is message body will get written.

params.name: mimeType
params.description: MIME Type of the message. When formatting message for writing this will be used. Supported values: Automatic, text/plain, application/xml, application/binary, application/json, text/xml

params.name: writeMode
params.description: Write mode to use - overwrite, append or create new. Supported values: Overwrite, Append, Create New

params.name: appendPosition
params.description: Position to append the content. Only used when WriteMode is APPEND.

params.name: encoding
params.description: Content Encoding. Applied when a value for content/expression is present.

params.name: compress
params.description: Whether to compress as a zip and write. Available only when WriteMode is Create New or OverWrite.

params.name: appendNewLine
params.description: Whether to append a new line character the the end of written content.

params.name: enableStreaming
params.description: Write to the file in streaming manner.

params.name: enableLock
params.description: Whether to lock the file when writing

params.name: updateLastModified
params.description: Set as false to skip updating the last modified timestamp

params.name: maxRetries
params.description: The maximum number of retries to be done in case of a failure.

params.name: retryDelay
params.description: The time interval between retries in milliseconds.

params.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
params.description: Time to wait between file size checks to ensure file stability in milliseconds (e.g., '2000', '5000'). Prevents writing to files still being modified.

params.name: updateFilePermission
params.description: File permission to set after writing (e.g., '755', '644'). Only supported for local file systems.

params.name: diskShareAccessMask
params.description: Comma separated access mask values for disk share. This is only applicable for SMB2 connection type.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: move
operations.description: Moves the File or Folder Specified by SourcePath into TargetPath

params.name: sourcePath
params.description: The path to the file to be copied.

params.name: targetPath
params.description: The target directory where to copy the file.

params.name: createParentDirectories
params.description: Whether or not to create parent directories if they dont exist in the target path.

params.name: includeParent
params.description: Whether to copy including parent folder of the source folder or only content inside.

params.name: overwrite
params.description: Whether or not to overwrite the file if the target destination already exists.

params.name: renameTo
params.description: The new name for the copied file. If not provided, the original file name is kept.

params.name: filePattern
params.description: The pattern (regex) of the files to be moved. Note: Use fileFilterType for advanced filtering.

params.name: fileFilterType
params.description: Type of pattern matching: 'ant' for Ant-style patterns (e.g., *.txt, **/*.java) or 'regex' for regular expressions. Supported values: ant, regex

params.name: includeFiles
params.description: Comma-separated patterns for files to include. Uses fileFilterType pattern matching (e.g., '*.txt,*.pdf' for Ant or '.*\.txt$,.*\.pdf$' for regex).

params.name: excludeFiles
params.description: Comma-separated patterns for files to exclude. Uses fileFilterType pattern matching. Exclude patterns take precedence over include patterns.

params.name: maxFileAge
params.description: Maximum age of files to move (e.g., '2h', '30m', '1d'). Supports units: s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days).

params.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
params.description: Time in milliseconds to wait between size checks for file stability verification. Ensures files are not actively being written before moving.

params.name: isSourceMounted

params.name: diskShareAccessMask

params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: read
operations.description: Read a file or files in a directory

params.name: path
params.description: Path to the file or folder to read.

params.name: filePattern
params.description: File pattern to match when choosing files to read in a folder. Not applicable when reading a file.

params.name: readMode
params.description: Read mode to use.  Supported values: Complete File, Starting From Line, Up To Line, Between Lines, Specific Line, Metadata Only

params.name: metadataOutputFormat
params.description: Format for metadata output. Options: default (MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm:ss), simple (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss), detailed (includes extended properties), iso8601 (ISO 8601 format), unix (Unix timestamp) Supported values: default, simple, detailed, iso8601, unix

params.name: startLineNum
params.description: Read file starting from this line.

params.name: endLineNum
params.description: Read file up to this line.

params.name: lineNum
params.description: Specific line number to read

params.name: contentType
params.description: MIME type of the message generated. If not provided it will try to interpret.

params.name: encoding
params.description: Encoding of the message generated.

params.name: enableStreaming
params.description: Read the file in streaming manner.

params.name: enableLock
params.description: Whether to lock the file when reading

params.name: maxRetries
params.description: The maximum number of retries to be done in case of a failure.

params.name: retryDelay
params.description: The time interval between retries in milliseconds.

params.name: fileFilterType
params.description: Type of file filtering pattern: 'ant' for Ant-style patterns or 'regex' for regular expressions. Only applicable when reading from directories. Supported values: ant, regex

params.name: includeFiles
params.description: Comma-separated patterns for files to include (e.g., '*.txt,*.csv' for Ant-style or '.*\.(txt|csv)' for regex). Only applicable when reading from directories.

params.name: excludeFiles
params.description: Comma-separated patterns for files to exclude (e.g., '*.tmp,*.log' for Ant-style or '.*\.(tmp|log)' for regex). Only applicable when reading from directories.

params.name: maxFileAge
params.description: Maximum age of files to consider for reading (e.g., '7d', '2h', '30m', '60s'). Files older than this will be excluded. Supports units: s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days). Only applicable when reading from directories.

params.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
params.description: Time to wait between file size checks to ensure file stability in milliseconds (e.g., '2000', '5000'). Prevents reading files still being written.

operations.name: exploreZipFile
operations.description: List Items In ZIP File Without Extracting

params.description: Path to zip file to explore

params.name: diskShareAccessMask
params.description: Comma separated access mask values for disk share. This is only applicable for SMB2 connection type.

params.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
params.description: Time to wait between file size checks to ensure file stability (e.g., '2s', '1000ms'). This prevents processing files that are still being uploaded or modified.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: connectionName
params.description: The name for the file connection

params.name: host
params.description: Host name of the FTP server

params.name: port
params.description: The port number of the FTP server

params.name: username
params.description: Username used to connect with the FTP server

params.name: password
params.description: Password to connect with the FTP server

params.name: encodePassword
params.description: Enable this to encode the password if it has special characters

params.name: userDirIsRoot
params.description: True if user directory is considered as root directory

params.name: workingDir
params.description: Working directory. File paths in operations should be given w.r.t this folder. Eg: /Users/username/Downloads

params.name: strictHostKeyChecking
params.description: Specifies whether the Host key should be checked. If set to 'true', the connector (JSch) will always verify the public key (fingerprint) of the SSH/SFTP server. Default 'no'

params.name: privateKeyFilePath
params.description: The identity files (private key file used to ssh). Public key should be installed on the server.

params.name: privateKeyPassword
params.description: The passphrase of the private key. The security of a key (even if encrypted) is retained because it is not available to anyone else. You can specify the passphrase when generating keys.

params.name: setAvoidPermission
params.description: Set to true if you want to avoid permission check.

params.name: sftpPathFromRoot
params.description: Set to true to enable absolute path access from filesystem root

params.name: maxActiveConnections
params.description: The maximum number of objects (including both idle and active/borrowed) that can exist within the pool at the same time

params.name: maxIdleConnections
params.description: The maximum number of connections that can remain idle in the pool at any time, awaiting to be borrowed. Excess idle objects may be removed.

params.name: maxWaitTime
params.description: This parameter determines how long the connector is willing to wait in the queue for a connection to become available. If the wait time exceeds the configured maximum wait time, the pool may throw an exception when it is exhausted and no connections are available.

params.name: evictionCheckInterval
params.description: This parameter specifies how frequently the evictor thread scans the pool for idle connections eligible for eviction. By configuring this interval, developers can control the frequency of resource checks, optimizing performance without unnecessary overhead.

params.name: minEvictionTime
params.description: Connections in the pool must remain idle for at least this specified duration before the evictor considers them for removal. This ensures that only connections inactive beyond a defined threshold are evicted, preventing premature eviction of frequently used resources.

params.name: exhaustedAction
params.description: Determines the action to take when the borrowObject() method is called, but the pool is exhausted.

params.name: sftpPoolConnectionAgedTimeout
params.description: Interval to close connections in the connection pool in seconds

params.name: sftpConnectionTimeout
params.description: The Jsch connection timeout in milli seconds.

params.name: sftpSessionTimeout
params.description: The Jsch session timeout in milli seconds.

params.name: fileLockScheme
params.description: File Locking Behaviour to use in operations associated with this connection. Supported values: Local, Cluster

params.name: fileCacheEnabled
params.description: Enable file caching for better performance

params.name: suspendOnConnectionFailure
params.description: Suspend connection on failure

params.name: retriesBeforeSuspension
params.description: Number of retries before suspending the connection

params.name: suspendInitialDuration
params.description: Initial duration in milliseconds to suspend the connection

params.name: suspendProgressionFactor
params.description: Progression factor for suspension duration

params.name: suspendMaximumDuration
params.description: Maximum duration in milliseconds to suspend the connection

params.name: connectionName
params.description: The name for the file connection

params.name: host
params.description: Host name of the SMB server

params.name: port
params.description: The port number of the SMB server

params.name: username
params.description: Username used to connect with the SMB server

params.name: password
params.description: Password to connect with the SMB server

params.name: workingDir

operations.name: write
operations.description: create file and writes the content

params.description: Path of the file to be written.

params.description: Static content or expression to receive content. If not given what is message body will get written.

params.description: MIME Type of the message. When formatting message for writing this will be used. Supported values: Automatic, text/plain, application/xml, application/binary, application/json, text/xml

params.description: Write mode to use - overwrite, append or create new. Supported values: Overwrite, Append, Create New

params.name: appendPosition
params.description: Position to append the content. Only used when WriteMode is APPEND.

params.description: Content Encoding. Applied when a value for content/expression is present.

params.description: Whether to compress as a zip and write. Available only when WriteMode is Create New or OverWrite.

params.name: appendNewLine
params.description: Whether to append a new line character the the end of written content.

params.name: enableStreaming
params.description: Write to the file in streaming manner.

params.name: enableLock
params.description: Whether to lock the file when writing

params.name: updateLastModified
params.description: Set as false to skip updating the last modified timestamp

params.name: maxRetries
params.description: The maximum number of retries to be done in case of a failure.

params.name: retryDelay
params.description: The time interval between retries in milliseconds.

params.name: timeBetweenSizeCheck
params.description: Time to wait between file size checks to ensure file stability in milliseconds (e.g., '2000', '5000'). Prevents writing to files still being modified.

params.name: updateFilePermission
params.description: File permission to set after writing (e.g., '755', '644'). Only supported for local file systems.

params.name: diskShareAccessMask

params.name: responseVariable

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: strictHostKeyChecking
params.description: Specifies whether the Host key should be checked. If set to 'true', the connector (JSch) will always verify the public key (fingerprint) of the SSH/SFTP server. Default 'no'

params.name: privateKeyFilePath
params.description: The identity files (private key file used to ssh). Public key should be installed on the server.

params.description: Set to true if you want to avoid permission check.

params.description: Set to true to enable absolute path access from filesystem root

params.name: maxActiveConnections
params.description: The maximum number of objects (including both idle and active/borrowed) that can exist within the pool at the same time

params.name: maxIdleConnections
params.description: The maximum number of connections that can remain idle in the pool at any time, awaiting to be borrowed. Excess idle objects may be removed.

params.name: maxWaitTime
params.description: This parameter determines how long the connector is willing to wait in the queue for a connection to become available. If the wait time exceeds the configured maximum wait time, the pool may throw an exception when it is exhausted and no connections are available.

params.name: evictionCheckInterval
params.description: This parameter specifies how frequently the evictor thread scans the pool for idle connections eligible for eviction. By configuring this interval, developers can control the frequency of resource checks, optimizing performance without unnecessary overhead.

params.name: minEvictionTime
params.description: Connections in the pool must remain idle for at least this specified duration before the evictor considers them for removal. This ensures that only connections inactive beyond a defined threshold are evicted, preventing premature eviction of frequently used resources.

params.name: exhaustedAction
params.description: Determines the action to take when the borrowObject() method is called, but the pool is exhausted.

params.name: sftpPoolConnectionAgedTimeout
params.description: Interval to close connections in the connection pool in seconds

params.name: sftpConnectionTimeout
params.description: The Jsch connection timeout in milli seconds.

params.name: sftpSessionTimeout
params.description: The Jsch session timeout in milli seconds.

params.description: The maximum number of connections that can remain idle in the pool at any time, awaiting to be borrowed. Excess idle objects may be removed.

params.name: maxWaitTime
params.description: This parameter determines how long the connector is willing to wait in the queue for a connection to become available. If the wait time exceeds the configured maximum wait time, the pool may throw an exception when it is exhausted and no connections are available.

params.name: evictionCheckInterval
params.description: This parameter specifies how frequently the evictor thread scans the pool for idle connections eligible for eviction. By configuring this interval, developers can control the frequency of resource checks, optimizing performance without unnecessary overhead.

params.name: minEvictionTime
params.description: Connections in the pool must remain idle for at least this specified duration before the evictor considers them for removal. This ensures that only connections inactive beyond a defined threshold are evicted, preventing premature eviction of frequently used resources.

params.name: exhaustedAction
params.description: Determines the action to take when the borrowObject() method is called, but the pool is exhausted.

params.name: sftpPoolConnectionAgedTimeout
params.description: Interval to close connections in the connection pool in seconds

params.name: sftpConnectionTimeout
params.description: The Jsch connection timeout in milli seconds.

params.name: sftpSessionTimeout
params.description: The Jsch session timeout in milli seconds.

params.name: fileLockScheme
params.description: File Locking Behaviour to use in operations associated with this connection. Supported values: Local, Cluster

mi_connectors.name: File Event Listener
mi_connectors.description: The inbound endpoint repository provides a mechanism for handling incoming messages or files, enabling integration with external systems.

meta.name: File Event Listener
meta.description: File Event Listener

operations.name: init
operations.description: Initialize File Inbound Endpoint

params.name: scheduleType
params.description: The polling type for the connection.

params.name: interval
params.description: The interval for the connection.

params.name: cronExpression
params.description: The cron for the connection.

params.name: fileThrottlingType
params.description: Choose how file processing is controlled.

params.name: transport.vfs.FileProcessCount
params.description: Maximum number of files to process in a single polling cycle.

params.name: transport.vfs.FileProcessInterval
params.description: Delay (in milliseconds) between processing consecutive files.

params.name: transport.vfs.MoveAfterProcess
params.description: URI for the target location.

params.name: transport.vfs.MoveAfterFailure
params.description: URI for the target location for failed files.

params.name: transport.vfs.CheckSizeIgnoreEmpty
params.description: When true, empty files are ignored during file size checks.

params.name: transport.vfs.CheckSizeInterval
params.description: Duration in milliseconds between file size checks.

params.name: transport.vfs.MinimumAge
params.description: Minimum age in seconds since the last modification before processing a file.

params.name: transport.vfs.MaximumAge
params.description: Maximum age in seconds since the last modification; older files will be skipped.

params.name: transport.vfs.FileSizeLimit
params.description: Process files whose size is  this value (in bytes). Use -1 for unlimited.

meta.name: Gmail
meta.description: Gmail connector allows you to send and access e-mail messages which are in your Gmail mailbox. The connector uses the standard IMAP and SMTP protocols with the extensions provided by Google to provide a more Gmail-like experience.

meta.name: Google BigQuery
meta.description: The BigQuery connector allows you to access the BigQuery REST API through WSO2 ESB. BigQuery is a tool that allows you to execute SQL-like queries on large amounts of data at outstanding speeds.

operations.name: listTables
operations.description: List Tables

params.name: projectId
params.description: Project ID of the tables to list

params.name: datasetId
params.description: Dataset ID of the tables to list

params.name: maxResults
params.description: Maximum number of results to return

params.name: pageToken
params.description: Page token, returned by a previous call, to request the next page of results

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: runQuery
operations.description: Run Query

params.name: projectId
params.description: Project ID of the project billed for the query

params.name: query
params.description: A query string, following the BigQuery query syntax, of the query to execute

params.name: defaultDatasetId
params.description: A unique ID for this dataset, without the project name. The ID must contain only letters (a-z, A-Z), numbers (0-9), or underscores (_). The maximum length is 1,024 characters

params.name: defaultProjectId
params.description: The ID of the project containing this dataset

params.name: useLegacySql
params.description: Specifies whether to use BigQuery's legacy SQL dialect for this query. The default value is true. If set to false, the query will use BigQuery's standard SQL

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of rows of data to return per page of results. Responses are also limited to 10 MB. By default, there is no maximum row count, and only the byte limit applies

params.name: timeoutMs
params.description: How long to wait for the query to complete, in milliseconds, before the request times out and returns
