meta.name: Kafka
meta.description: The Kafka connector allows you to access the Kafka Producer API through WSO2 MI. Hence, Kafka connector acts as a message producer which facilitates publishing messages from WSO2 MI to Kafka topics.

operations.name: publishMessages
operations.description: Publish Messages

params.name: topic
params.description: The name of the topic.

params.name: partitionNo
params.description: The partition number of the topic.

params.name: key
params.description: The key of the message.

params.name: value
params.description: The value of the kafka message.

params.name: forwardExistingHeaders
params.description: Specifies whether to include existing transport headers in the Kafka message; can be none, all, or filtered Supported values: None, All, Filtered

params.name: kafkaHeaderPrefix
params.description: Specifies a prefix to filter out the Kafka related headers from the transport headers that start when forwardExistingHeaders is set to filtered

params.name: removeHeaderPrefix
params.description: Indicates whether the configured prefix should be removed from header names before sending them to Kafka (applies when filtering).

params.name: removeFilteredAfterSend
params.description: Determines whether the filtered transport headers should be removed from the transport headers after being forwarded to Kafka.

params.name: keySchema
params.description: The Schema of the configured key.

params.name: keySchemaId
params.description: The Schema id of the key schema that is stored in the confluent schema registry.

params.name: keySchemaVersion
params.description: The Version of the key schema that is stored in the confluent schema registry.

params.name: keySchemaSubject
params.description: The Subject of the key schema that is stored in the confluent schema registry.

params.name: keySchemaMetadata
params.description: The Schema metadata of the key schema that is stored in the confluent schema registry.

params.name: keySchemaSoftDeleted
params.description: Whether soft deleted key schemas also need to be considered.

params.name: valueSchema
params.description: The Schema of the configured value.

params.name: valueSchemaId
params.description: The Schema id of the value schema that is stored in the confluent schema registry.

params.name: valueSchemaVersion
params.description: The Version of the value schema that is stored in the confluent schema registry.

params.name: valueSchemaSubject
params.description: The Subject of the value schema that is stored in the confluent schema registry.

params.name: valueSchemaMetadata
params.description: The Schema metadata of the value schema that is stored in the confluent schema registry.

params.name: valueSchemaSoftDeleted
params.description: Whether soft deleted value schemas also need to be considered.

params.name: customHeaderExpression
params.description: Inject a list of headers via an expression that is evaluated at runtime. E.g., `json-eval($.headers)`.

params.name: dlqTopic
params.description: The topic name of the Dead Letter Queue to which the failed messages should be redirected. This is applicable only when the sendCallbackHandler class has support for Dead Letter Queue (DLQ) handling.

params.name: connectionName
params.description: The name for the kafka connection

params.name: bootstrapServers
params.description: The Kafka brokers listed in the form host1:port1,host2:port2,...

params.name: keySerializerClass
params.description: The serializer class for the key that implements the serializer interface.

params.name: valueSerializerClass
params.description: The serializer class for the value that implements the serializer interface.

params.name: schemaRegistryUrl
params.description: The URL of the Confluent Schema Registry.

params.name: basicAuthCredentialsSource
params.description: The credentials source, if the confluent Schema Registry is secured with basic authorization.

params.name: basicAuthUserInfo
params.description: The credentials for Confluent Schema Registry URL, if basicAuthCredentialsSource is set to USER_INFO.

params.name: keySubjectNameStrategy
params.description: The strategy for determining the subject name under which the key schema is registered.

params.name: subjectNameStrategy
params.description: The strategy for determining the subject name under which the value schema is registered.

params.name: autoRegisterSchemas
params.description: Serializer will/will not attempt to register new schemas.

params.name: useLatestVersion
params.description: Serializer retrieve the latest schema version for the subject.

params.name: bufferMemory
params.description: The total bytes of memory the producer can use to buffer records waiting to be sent to the server.

params.name: compressionType
params.description: The compression type for the data generated by the producer. Supported values: none, gzip, snappy, lz4, zstd

params.name: retries
params.description: Set a value greater than zero if you want the client to resent any records automatically when a request fails.

params.name: batchSize
params.description: Specify how many records the producer should batch together when multiple records are sent to the same partition.

params.name: clientId
params.description: The client identifier that you pass to the server when making requests.

params.name: connectionsMaxIdleTime
params.description: The duration in milliseconds after which idle connections should be closed.

params.name: lingerTime
params.description: The time, in milliseconds, to wait before sending a record. Set this property when you want the client to reduce the number of requests sent when the load is moderate. This adds a small delay rather than immediately sending out a record. Therefore, the producer waits up to allow other records to be sent so that the requests can be batched together.

params.name: maxBlockTime
params.description: The maximum time in milliseconds that the KafkaProducer.send() and the KafkaProducer.partitionsFor() methods can be blocked.

params.name: maxRequestSize
params.description: The maximum size of a request in bytes.

params.name: partitionerClass
params.description: The partitioner class that implements the partitioner interface.

params.name: sendBufferBytes
params.description: The size of the TCP send buffer (SO_SNDBUF) to use when sending data.

params.name: receiveBufferBytes
params.description: The size of the TCP receive buffer (SO_RCVBUF) to use when reading data.

params.name: requestTimeout
params.description: The maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, that a client waits for the server to respond.

params.name: acks
params.description: The number of acknowledgments that the producer requires for the leader to receive before considering a request to be complete. Supported values: all, -1, 0, 1

params.name: enableIdempotence
params.description: When set to true, the producer will ensure that exactly one copy of each message is written in the stream. If false, producer retries due to broker failures, etc., may write duplicates of the retried message in the stream.

params.name: maxInFlightRequestsPerConnection
params.description: The maximum number of unacknowledged requests that the client can send via a single connection before blocking.

params.name: reconnectBackoff
params.description: The amount of time to wait before attempting to reconnect to a given host.

params.name: reconnectBackoffMax
params.description: The maximum amount of time in milliseconds to wait when reconnecting to a broker that has repeatedly failed to connect.

params.name: retryBackoff
params.description: The amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait before attempting to retry a failed request to a given topic partition.

params.name: metadataMaxAge
params.description: The period of time, in milliseconds, after which you should refresh metadata even if there was no partition leadership changes to proactively discover any new brokers or partitions.

params.name: metadataFetchTimeout
params.description: The maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, to block and wait for the metadata fetch to succeed before throwing an exception to the client.

params.name: metricReporters
params.description: A list of classes to use as metrics reporters.

params.name: metricsNumSamples
params.description: The number of samples maintained to compute metrics.

params.name: metricsSampleWindow
params.description: The window of time, in milliseconds, that a metrics sample is computed over.

params.name: sendCallbackHandlerClass
params.description: The class name of the producer(send) callback handler implementation.

params.name: poolingEnabled
params.description: Whether connection pooling is enabled or not.

params.name: maxActiveConnections
params.description: Maximum number of active connections.

params.name: maxIdleConnections
params.description: Maximum number of idle connections.

params.name: maxWaitTime
params.description: Maximum time to wait for a pooled component to become available.

params.name: minEvictionTime
params.description: The minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction.

params.name: evictionCheckInterval
params.description: The number of milliseconds between runs of the object evictor.

params.name: exhaustedAction
params.description: The behavior of the pool when the pool is exhausted. Supported values: 0, 1, 2

params.name: connectionName
params.description: The name for the kafka connection

params.name: bootstrapServers
params.description: The Kafka brokers listed in the form host1:port1,host2:port2,...

params.name: keySerializerClass
params.description: The serializer class for the key that implements the serializer interface.

params.name: valueSerializerClass
params.description: The serializer class for the value that implements the serializer interface.

params.name: securityProtocol
params.description: The protocol used to communicate with brokers. Supported values: PLAINTEXT, SSL, SASL_PLAINTEXT, SASL_SSL

params.name: sslTruststoreLocation
params.description: The location of the trust store file.

params.name: sslTruststorePassword
params.description: The password for the trust store file.

params.name: sslTruststoreType
params.description: The format of the trust store file.

params.name: sslKeystoreLocation
params.description: The location of the key store file. Setting this for the client is optional. Set this when you want to have two-way authentication for the client.

params.name: sslKeystorePassword
params.description: The store password for the keystore file. Setting this for the client is optional. Set it only if ssl.keystore.location is configured.

params.name: sslKeystoreType
params.description: The format of the keystore file. Setting this for the client is optional.

params.name: sslKeyPassword
params.description: The password of the private key in the keystore file. Setting this for the client is optional.

params.name: sslEnabledProtocols
params.description: The list of protocols enabled for SSL connections.

params.name: sslCipherSuites
params.description: A list of cipher suites.

params.name: sslProtocol
params.description: The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext.

params.name: sslProvider
params.description: The name of the security provider used for SSL connections. The default value is the default security provider of the JVM.

params.name: sslEndpointIdentificationAlgorithm
params.description: The endpoint identification algorithm to validate the server hostname using a server certificate.

params.name: sslKeymanagerAlgorithm
params.description: The algorithm used by the key manager factory for SSL connections. The default value is the key manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.

params.name: sslTrustmanagerAlgorithm
params.description: The algorithm used by the trust manager factory for SSL connections. The default value is the trust manager factory algorithm configured for the Java Virtual Machine.

params.name: sslSecureRandomImplementation
params.description: The SecureRandom PRNG implementation to use for SSL cryptography operations.

params.name: saslMechanism
params.description: The SASL mechanism to use for authentication. Supported values: PLAIN, SCRAM-SHA-256, SCRAM-SHA-512, GSSAPI, OAUTHBEARER

params.name: saslJaasConfig
params.description: JAAS login context parameters for SASL connections in the format used by JAAS configuration files.

params.name: saslLoginCallbackHandlerClass
params.description: The fully qualified name of a SASL login callback handler class that implements the AuthenticateCallbackHandler interface.

params.name: saslKerberosServiceName
params.description: The Kerberos principal name that Kafka runs as.

params.name: saslKerberosKinitCmd
params.description: The kerberos kinit command path.

params.name: saslKerberosMinTimeBeforeRelogin
params.description: Login thread's sleep time, in milliseconds, between refresh attempts.

params.name: saslKerberosTicketRenewJitter
params.description: Percentage of random jitter added to the renewal time.

params.name: saslKerberosTicketRenewWindowFactor
params.description: The login thread sleeps until the specified window factor of time from the last refresh to the ticket's expiry is reached, after which it will try to renew the ticket.

params.name: saslOauthbearerTokenEndpointUrl
params.description: The URL for the OAuth/OIDC identity provider.

params.name: saslOauthbearerScopeClaimName
params.description: The override name of the scope claim.

params.name: saslLoginConnectTimeout
params.description: The duration, in milliseconds, for HTTPS connect timeout.

params.name: saslLoginReadTimeout
params.description: The duration, in milliseconds, for HTTPS read timeout.

params.name: saslLoginRetryBackoff
params.description: The duration, in milliseconds, to wait between HTTPS call attempts.

params.name: saslLoginRetryBackoffMax
params.description: The maximum duration, in milliseconds, for HTTPS call attempts.

params.name: schemaRegistryUrl
params.description: The URL of the Confluent Schema Registry.

params.name: basicAuthCredentialsSource
params.description: The credentials source, if the confluent Schema Registry is secured with basic authorization.

params.name: basicAuthUserInfo
params.description: The credentials for Confluent Schema Registry URL, if basicAuthCredentialsSource is set to USER_INFO.

params.name: keySubjectNameStrategy
params.description: The strategy for determining the subject name under which the key schema is registered.

params.name: subjectNameStrategy
params.description: The strategy for determining the subject name under which the value schema is registered.

params.description: Serializer will/will not attempt to register new schemas.

meta.name: Kafka (Inbound)
meta.description: Kafka inbound endpoint acts as a message consumer for Kafka. It receives messages from configured topics of Kafka platform and inject them into the mediation flow.

operations.name: init
operations.description: Initialize Kafka Inbound Endpoint

params.name: name
params.description: Unique identifier for the Kafka event integration.

params.name: sequence
params.description: Sequence to inject the Kafka message

params.name: onError
params.description: Error sequence to invoke on fault

params.name: interval
params.description: The polling interval for the Kafka inbound endpoint in milliseconds.

params.name: sequential
params.description: The behaviour when executing the given sequence.

params.name: coordination
params.description: In a clustered setup, this will run the inbound only in a single worker node.

params.name: suspend
params.description: Enable this option to suspend the inbound endpoint immediately after deployment.

params.name: bootstrap.servers
params.description: Comma-separated list of host:port pairs of Kafka brokers.

params.name: topic.name
params.description: Name of the Kafka topic to subscribe to.

params.name: group.id
params.description: Consumer group ID to use when consuming messages.

params.name: contentType
params.description: Consumer group ID to use when consuming messages.

params.name: poll.timeout
params.description: The timeout in milliseconds when polling for consumer data.

params.name: key.deserializer
params.description: Deserializer class for key that implements the org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.Deserializer interface.

params.name: value.deserializer
params.description: Deserializer class for value that implements the org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.Deserializer interface.

params.name: schema.registry.url
params.description: Comma-separated list of URLs for Schema Registry instances that can be used to register or look up schemas.

params.name: basic.auth.credentials.source
params.description: Specify how to pick the credentials for the Basic authentication header.

params.name: basic.auth.user.info
params.description: Specify the user info for the Basic authentication in the form of {username}:{password}.

params.name: avro.use.logical.type.converters
params.description: Whether to enable the use of logical type converters in Avro.

params.name: key.delegate.deserializer
params.description: The actual key deserializer that the error handling deserializer should delegate to.

params.name: value.delegate.deserializer
params.description: The actual value deserializer that the error handling deserializer should delegate to.

params.name: topic.pattern
params.description: The name pattern of the topic.

params.name: client.id
params.description: An id string to pass to the server when making requests.

params.name: enable.auto.commit
params.description: Whether the consumer will automatically commit offsets periodically at the interval set by auto.commit.interval.ms.

params.name: auto.commit.interval.ms
params.description: Offsets are committed automatically with a frequency controlled by the config.

params.name: failure.retry.count
params.description: The maximum attempts the same Kafka message should be retried in a failure scenario.

params.name: failure.retry.interval
params.description: The interval between retries in a failure scenario.

params.name: auto.offset.reset
params.description: Defines what to do when there is no initial offset in Kafka or if the current offset does not exist any more on the server.

params.name: kafka.header.prefix
params.description: The prefix for Kafka headers.

params.name: exclude.internal.topics
params.description: Whether internal topics matching a subscribed pattern should be excluded from the subscription.

params.name: check.crcs
params.description: Automatically check the CRC32 of the records consumed.

params.name: topic.partitions
params.description: Comma separated list of partitions of the topic which the consumer has subscribed to.

params.name: partition.assignment.strategy
params.description: A list of class names or class types, ordered by preference, of supported partition assignment strategies.

params.name: interceptor.classes
params.description: A list of classes to use as interceptors.

params.name: metadata.max.age.ms
params.description: The period of time in milliseconds after which we force a refresh of metadata

params.name: fetch.min.bytes
params.description: The minimum amount of data the server should return for a fetch request.

params.name: fetch.max.bytes
params.description: The maximum amount of data the server should return for a fetch request.

params.name: max.partition.fetch.bytes
params.description: The maximum amount of data per-partition the server will return.

params.name: max.poll.interval.ms
params.description: The maximum delay between polls when using consumer group management.

params.name: max.poll.records
params.description: The maximum number of records returned in a single poll

params.name: fetch.max.wait.ms
params.description: The maximum amount of time the server will block before answering the fetch request if there isnt sufficient data to immediately satisfy the requirement given by fetch.min.bytes.

params.name: receive.buffer.bytes
params.description: The size of the TCP receive buffer to use when reading data.

params.name: send.buffer.bytes
params.description: The size of the TCP send buffer (SO_SNDBUF) to use when sending data.

params.name: request.timeout.ms
params.description: The maximum amount of time the client will wait for the response of a request.

params.name: reconnect.backoff.ms
params.description: The amount of time to wait before attempting to reconnect to a given host.

params.name: retry.backoff.ms

meta.name: LDAP
meta.description: The LDAP Connector provides access for LDAP servers through a simple web services interface to do CURD (Create, Update, Read, Delete) operations on LDAP entries.

operations.name: updateEntry
operations.description: Update LDAP Entry

params.name: dn
params.description: The distinguished name (DN) of the LDAP entry to update. Example: cn=John Doe,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: attributes
params.description: The attributes to update for the LDAP entry, provided as key-value pairs. Example: {"mail":"john.doe@example.com","telephoneNumber"="123456789"}

params.name: mode
params.description: The update mode: ADD to add new attributes, REPLACE to overwrite existing values, or REMOVE to delete attributes.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned.

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: searchEntry
operations.description: Search LDAP Entry

params.name: dn
params.description: The distinguished name (base DN) from where the search should begin. Example: ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: filters
params.description: Search filters in comma-separated key-value format. Example: cn=John,mail=john.doe@example.com

params.name: objectClass
params.description: The object class of the LDAP entry to search for. Example: inetOrgPerson

params.name: attributes
params.description: Attributes to include in the search result. Example: cn,sn,mail

params.name: limit
params.description: Maximum number of search results to return. Use 0 for unlimited.

params.name: scope
params.description: Specifies the search depth: `base` searches only the specified entry, `one` searches its immediate children, and `sub` searches the entire subtree rooted at baseDN.

params.name: onlyOneReference
params.description: If true, ensures only one reference is returned.

params.name: allowEmptySearchResult
params.description: If true, no exception will be thrown when the search returns no result.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned.

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: deleteEntry
operations.description: Delete LDAP Entry

params.name: dn
params.description: The distinguished name (DN) of the LDAP entry to be deleted. Example: cn=John Doe,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned.

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: addEntry
operations.description: Add LDAP Entry

params.name: dn
params.description: The distinguished name of the LDAP entry to be added. Example: cn=John Doe,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: objectClass
params.description: The object class of the LDAP entry. Example: inetOrgPerson, organizationalUnit

params.name: attributes
params.description: A set of attributes for the new LDAP entry in JSON format. Example: {"sn":"Doe", "givenName":"John", "mail":"john.doe@example.com"}

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned.

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: updateName
operations.description: Rename LDAP Entry

params.name: oldName
params.description: The current fully qualified distinguished name (DN) of the LDAP entry. Example: cn=John Doe,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: newName
params.description: The new fully qualified distinguished name (DN) for the LDAP entry. Example: cn=John Smith,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned.

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: authenticate
operations.description: Authenticate LDAP User

params.name: dn
params.description: The distinguished name (DN) of the LDAP entry to authenticate. Example: cn=John Doe,ou=Users,dc=example,dc=com

params.name: password

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned.

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.description: The unique name of the connection to LDAP.

params.name: secureConnection
params.description: Boolean value to enable or disable secure connection to LDAP.

params.name: disableSSLCertificateChecking
params.description: Boolean value to disable or enable SSL certificate checking for LDAP.

params.name: providerUrl
params.description: URI of the LDAP directory, e.g., ldap://<host>:<port>/

params.name: securityPrincipal
params.description: Username used to log in to LDAP.

params.name: securityCredentials
params.description: Password used to log in to LDAP.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Timeout duration of the LDAP request in milliseconds.

params.name: connectionPoolingEnabled
params.description: Enable or disable connection pooling for LDAP.

params.name: connectionPoolingProtocol
params.description: Space-separated protocol types for connection pooling. Valid values: 'plain', 'ssl'.

params.name: connectionPoolingInitSize

meta.name: MongoDB
meta.description:
MongoDB is a cross-platform document-oriented program which is classified as a NoSQL database.
This connector allows you to connect to the Mongo database via different connection URLs in order to perform CRUD operations on the database.

params.name: connectionName
params.description: The name for the MongoDB connection

params.name: inputType
params.description: Method to construct the connection URI. The connection string URI is a single string that contains all the information needed to connect to the database. The connection parameters are individual fields that can be used to construct the connection URI.

params.name: useDnsSrvLookup
params.description: Enable DNS SRV lookup for automatic server discovery. If not selected, you have to provide a seed list of hosts (if there are multiple hosts). If selected, the you have to provide the cluster root domain name (e.g. mongodb.example.com) in the host field. The driver will then use DNS SRV records to discover the hosts in the cluster.

params.name: connectionURI
params.description: The complete connection URI containing the server details, credentials, and the connection options. [prefix]://[username:password@]host1[:port1][,...hostN[:portN]][/[defaultauthdb][?options]]

params.name: database
params.description: The name of the database.

params.name: host
params.description: The host where the MongoDB instance is running.

params.name: port
params.description: The port where the MongoDB instance is running.

params.name: seedList
params.description: The list of host and port pairs.

params.name: database
params.description: The name of the database.

params.name: username
params.description: User's authentication credentials.

params.name: password
params.description: User's authentication credentials.

params.name: replicaSet
params.description: Specifies the name of the replica set.

params.name: authSource
params.description: Specifies the database name associated with the user's credentials.

params.name: authMechanism
params.description: Specify the authentication mechanism that MongoDB will use to authenticate the connection.

params.name: authMechanismProperties
params.description: Specify properties for the specified authMechanism as a comma-separated list of colon-separated key-value pairs.

params.name: gssapiServiceName
params.description: Set the Kerberos service name when connecting to Kerberized MongoDB instances.

params.name: w
params.description: Corresponds to the write concern w Option.

params.name: wtimeoutMS
params.description: Specifies a time limit, in milliseconds, for the write concern.

params.name: journal
params.description: Corresponds to the write concern j Option option.

params.name: maxPoolSize
params.description: The maximum number of connections in the connection pool.

params.name: minPoolSize
params.description: The minimum number of connections in the connection pool.

params.name: maxIdleTimeMS
params.description: The maximum number of milliseconds that a connection can remain idle in the pool before being removed and closed.

params.name: waitQueueMultiple
params.description: The maximum number of threads allowed to wait for a connection to become available from the pool.

params.name: waitQueueTimeoutMS
params.description: The maximum time in milliseconds that a thread can wait for a connection to become available.

params.name: ssl
params.description: The boolean to enable or disables TLS/SSL for the connection.

params.name: sslInvalidHostNamesAllowed
params.description: Disables hostname validation of the certificate presented by the mongod/mongos instance.

params.name: connectTimeoutMS
params.description: The time in milliseconds to attempt a connection before timing out.

params.name: socketTimeoutMS
params.description: The time in milliseconds to attempt a send or receive on a socket before the attempt times out.

params.name: compressors
params.description: Comma-delimited string of compressors to enable network compression for communication between this client and a mongod/mongos instance.

params.name: zlibCompressionLevel
params.description: An integer that specifies the compression level if using zlib for network compression.

params.name: readConcernLevel
params.description: The level of isolation.

params.name: readPreference
params.description: Specifies the read preferences for this connection.

params.name: maxStalenessSeconds
params.description: Specifies, in seconds, how stale a secondary can be before the client stops using it for read operations.

params.name: readPreferenceTags
params.description: Specifies the tags document as a comma-separated list of colon-separated key-value pairs.

params.name: localThresholdMS
params.description: The size (in milliseconds) of the latency window for selecting among multiple suitable MongoDB instances.

params.name: serverSelectionTimeoutMS
params.description: Specifies how long (in milliseconds) to block for server selection before throwing an exception.

params.name: serverSelectionTryOnce
params.description: Single-threaded drivers only.

params.name: heartbeatFrequencyMS
params.description: Controls when the driver checks the state of the MongoDB deployment.

params.name: appName
params.description: Specify a custom app name.

params.name: retryReads
params.description: Enables retryable reads.

params.name: retryWrites
params.description: Enable retryable writes.

params.name: uuidRepresentation
params.description: The type of UUID representation.

mi_connectors.name: Pulsar
mi_connectors.description: The Pulsar connector allows you to access the Apache Pulsar Producer Client API through WSO2 MI and acts as a message producer that facilitates message publishing

meta.name: Pulsar
meta.description: The Apache Pulsar connector allows you to access the Apache Pulsar Producer API through WSO2 MI. Hence, Apache Pulsar connector acts as a message producer which facilitates publishing messages from WSO2 MI to Apache Pulsar topics.

operations.name: publishMessage
operations.description: Publish Message

params.name: value
params.description: The payload or content of the message to be published.

params.name: key
params.description: The key associated with the message, used for partition routing.

params.name: sequenceId
params.description: The custom sequence ID to assign to the message.

params.name: deliverAfter
params.description: The delay in milliseconds after which the message will be delivered.

params.name: topicName
params.description: The name of the Pulsar topic to which messages will be published.

params.name: compressionType
params.description: The compression type to use for messages. Supported values: NONE, LZ4, ZLIB, ZSTD, SNAPPY. Supported values: NONE, LZ4, ZLIB, ZSTD, SNAPPY

params.name: sendMode
params.description: Whether to send the message synchronously or asynchronously. In synchronous mode, the operation waits for the message to be acknowledged by the broker. In asynchronous mode, the operation returns immediately. Supported values: Sync, Async

params.name: batchingEnabled
params.description: Whether message batching is enabled for the producer. Batching can improve throughput by sending multiple messages in a single request.

params.name: batchingMaxMessages
params.description: The maximum number of messages permitted in a batch.

params.name: batchingMaxBytes
params.description: The maximum size of a batch in bytes

params.name: batchingMaxPublishDelayMicros
params.description: The maximum delay in microseconds for batching messages before they are published.

params.name: chunkingEnabled
params.description: Whether chunking is enabled for large messages. If enabled, large messages are split into smaller chunks.

params.name: chunkMaxMessageSize
params.description: The maximum size (in bytes) of a single message before it gets chunked.

params.name: sendTimeoutMs
params.description: The timeout in milliseconds for a message to be sent. If the message is not acknowledged within this time, it is marked as failed.

params.name: blockIfQueueFull
params.description: Whether the producer should block when the outgoing message queue is full. If false, send operations will fail immediately when the queue is full.

meta.name: Redis
meta.description:
The Redis connector allows you to access the Redis commands through the WSO2 EI. Redis is an open source (BSD licensed), in-memory data structure store, used as a database, cache and message broker. It supports data structures such as strings, hashes, lists, sets, sorted sets with range queries, bitmaps, hyperloglogs and geospatial indexes with radius queries.
In latest version we have added following:
Previously we were creating a single pool for each cluster operation and closing it after each operation that's why read/write lock issue occurs (jmxRegister and jmxUnRegister on the same object). This Pr rectifies that and also avoids closing JedisCluster after each operation since It's no need to close the JedisCluster instance as it is handled by the JedisClusterConnectionPool itself.

Also introduced the "isJmxEnabled" property to enable JMX if required.

meta.name: Salesforce
meta.description: The Salesforce connector allows you to work with records in Salesforce, a web-based service that allows organizations to manage contact relationship management (CRM) data. You can use the Salesforce connector to create, query, retrieve, update, and delete records in your organization's Salesforce data. The connector uses the Salesforce SOAP API to interact with Salesforce.

meta.name: Salesforce Bulk
meta.description: The SalesforceBulk connector allows you to access the SalesforceBulk REST API through WSO2 ESB. SalesforceBulk is a RESTful API that is optimal for loading or deleting large sets of data. You can use it to query, insert, update, upsert, or delete a large number of records asynchronously by submitting batches that Salesforce processes in the background.

params.name: inputStructure
params.description: The type of input data structure. Supported values: FORM, INLINE

params.name: assetId
params.description: The ID of the asset to be updated.

params.name: payload
params.description: The JSON payload required to create a new asset.

params.name: customerKey
params.description: Reference to customer's private ID/name for the asset.

params.name: contentType
params.description: The type that the content attribute will be in.

params.name: data
params.description: Property bag containing the asset data.

params.name: assetType
params.description: The type of the asset saved as a name/ID pair.

params.name: version
params.description: The version of the asset.

params.name: locked
params.description: Specifies if the asset can be modified or not.

params.name: fileProperties
params.description: Stores the different properties that this asset refers to if it is a file type.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the asset, set by the client. 200 character maximum.

params.name: description
params.description: Description of the asset, set by the client.

params.name: category
params.description: ID of the category the asset belongs to.

params.name: tags
params.description: List of tags associated with the asset.

params.name: content
params.description: The actual content of the asset.

params.name: design
params.description: Fallback for display when neither content nor supercontent are provided.

params.name: superContent
params.description: Content that supersedes content in terms of display.

params.name: customFields
params.description: Custom fields within an asset.

params.name: views
params.description: Views within an asset.

params.name: blocks
params.description: Blocks within the asset.

params.name: minBlocks
params.description: Minimum number of blocks within an asset.

params.name: maxBlocks
params.description: Maximum number of blocks within an asset.

params.name: channels
params.description: List of channels that are allowed to use this asset.

params.name: allowedBlocks
params.description: List of blocks that are allowed in the asset.

params.name: slots
params.description: Slots within the asset.

params.name: businessUnitAvailability
params.description: A dictionary of member IDs that have been granted access to the asset.

params.name: template
params.description: Template the asset follows.

params.name: file
params.description: Base64-encoded string of a file associated with an asset.

params.name: generateFrom
params.description: Tells the sending compiler what view to use for generating this view's content.

params.name: sharingProperties
params.description: Allows you to share content with one or more business units that have Content Builder Sharing enabled.

params.name: sharingProperties.sharedWith
params.description: List of MID IDs the asset is shared with.

params.name: sharingProperties.sharingType
params.description: Indicates the permission that you are granting to the list of MIDs in sharedWith. Possible values are view, edit, or local.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.description: The type of input data structure. Supported values: FORM, INLINE

params.name: payload
params.description: The properties required to create a new category.

params.name: name
params.description: Required. Name of the category.

params.name: parentId
params.description: Required. ID of the parent category.

params.name: categoryType
params.description: The type of category, either asset or asset-shared, which is automatically set to the CategoryType of the parent category. If set to asset-shared, include the SharingProperties in the call.

params.name: enterpriseId
params.description: ID of the enterprise this business unit belongs to.

params.name: memberId
params.description: ID of the member who creates the category.

params.name: description
params.description: Description of the category.

params.name: sharingProperties
params.description: Allows you to share categories with one or more business units that have Content Builder Sharing enabled. Stores the MIDs of business units this category is shared with and the sharing type.

params.name: sharingProperties.sharedWith
params.description: List of up to 100 MID IDs the category is shared with. To share the category with all business units in the enterprise, and if your account has access to Content Builder Across Enterprise Sharing, set this to 0.

params.name: sharingProperties.sharingType
params.description: Indicates the permission that you are granting to the list of MIDs in SharedWith. The only possible value for categories is edit.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: createEmailDefinition
operations.description: Create Email Definition

params.name: inputStructure
params.description: The type of input data structure. Supported values: FORM, INLINE

params.name: payload
params.description: The properties required to create a new email definition.

params.name: definitionKey
params.description: Required. Unique, user-generated key to access the definition object.

params.name: name
params.description: Required. Name of the definition. Must be unique.

params.name: content.customerKey
params.description: Required. Unique identifier of the content asset.

params.name: status
params.description: Operational state of the definition: active, inactive, or deleted. A message sent to an active definition is processed and delivered. A message sent to an inactive definition isnt processed or delivered. Instead, the message is queued for later processing for up to three days.

params.name: description
params.description: User-provided description of the send definition.

params.name: classification
params.description: The external key of a sending classification defined in Email Studio Administration. Only transactional classifications are permitted. Default is default transactional.

params.name: subscriptions.list
params.description: Required. The external key of the list or all subscribers. Contains the subscriber keys and profile attributes.

params.name: subscriptions.dataExtension
params.description: The external key of the triggered send data extension. Each request inserts as a new row in the data extension. To deduplicate at send time, use messageKey. Dont use a primary key on the triggered send data extension.

params.name: subscriptions.autoAddSubscriber
params.description: Adds the recipients email address and contact key as a subscriber key to subscriptions.list. Default is true.

params.name: subscriptions.updateSubscriber
params.description: Updates the recipients contact key as a subscriber key with the provided email address and profile attributes to subscriptions.list. Default is true.

params.name: options.trackLinks
params.description: Wraps links for tracking and reporting. Default is true.

params.name: options.cc
params.description: Include CC email addresses with every send. To CC dynamically at send time, create a profile attribute and use the %%attribute%% syntax.

params.name: options.bcc
params.description: Include BCC email addresses with every send. To BCC dynamically at send time, create a profile attribute and use the %%attribute%% syntax.

params.name: options.createJourney
params.description: A value of true updates the send definition to make it available in Journey Builder as a Transactional Send Journey. After the definition is tied to a Transactional Send Journey, the definition remains part of Journey Builder. You cant unlink a journey from a definition without recreating the transactional send definition.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

operations.name: createSmsDefinition
operations.description: Create SMS Definition

params.name: inputStructure
params.description: The type of input data structure. Supported values: FORM, INLINE

params.name: payload
params.description: The properties required to create a new SMS definition.

params.name: definitionKey
params.description: Required. Unique, user-generated key to access the definition object.

params.name: name
params.description: Required. Name of the definition. Must be unique.

params.name: content.message
params.description: Required. The message content that you want sent with each message. Use substitution strings and AMPscript to personalize the message.

params.name: status
params.description: Operational state of the definition: active, inactive, or deleted. A message sent to an active definition is processed and delivered. A message sent to an inactive definition isnt processed or delivered. Instead, the message is queued for later processing for up to three days.

params.name: description
params.description: User-provided description of the send definition.

params.name: subscriptions.shortCode
params.description: Required. The short or long code for the mobile transmissions for each message on this definition.

params.name: subscriptions.countryCode
params.description: The country code associated with the shortCode for the mobile transmissions for each message on this definition. Don't use for long codes, unless your account configuration requires it.

params.name: subscriptions.keyword
params.description: Required. The keyword used to track messages.

params.name: subscriptions.autoAddSubscriber
params.description: Allows you to add a recipient as subscriber against the shortCode using contactKey. When false, the message is rejected if contactKey doesnt exist as a subscriber. Default is true.

params.name: options.urlShortenerOptions.IsLinkShorteningEnabled
params.description: Indicates if URL shortening is enabled for URLs in the message body. The values are true and false.

params.name: options.urlShortenerOptions.isSubscriberTrackingEnabled
params.description: Indicates if subscriber level tracking is enabled for URLs in the message body. The values are true and false. The value is true if the value of shortenerType is SFMC.

params.name: options.urlShortenerOptions.shortenerType
params.description: The type of URL shortener. The value is SFMC.

params.name: options.SmsMessageRegulatoryAuthorityTemplateId
params.description: The ID of the DLT template used in the SMS. This attribute is available only for customers in India.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the Message Body in Message Context with the output of the operation (This will remove the payload from the above variable).

params.name: recipients

params.name: subscriptions

params.name: content
params.description: Overrides content in send definition. Supports substitution strings.

params.name: attributes
params.description: Key-value pairs used to personalize the message globally.

mi_connectors.name: Salesforce Pub/Sub

meta.name: Salesforce Pub/Sub
meta.description: The Salesforce Pub/Sub connector allows you to publish and subscribe to events in Salesforce. It enables you to integrate Salesforce with other systems by sending and receiving messages through the Pub/Sub API. This connector provides operations for publishing events, and subscribing to topics.

meta.name: SalesforceRest
meta.description: The Salesforce connector allows you to work with records in Salesforce, a web-based service that allows organizations to manage contact relationship management (CRM) data. You can use the Salesforce connector to create, query, retrieve, update, and delete records in your organization's Salesforce data. The connector uses the Slaesforce REST API to interact with Salesforce.

meta.name: ServiceNow
meta.description: The ServiceNow connector allows you to access the ServiceNow REST API through WSO2 MI. ServiceNow is a software platform that supports IT service management and automates common business processes. This software as a service (SaaS) platform contains a number of modular applications that can vary by instance and user.

meta.name: SMPP
meta.description: SMPP Connector allows you to send SMS through the WSO2 EI. It uses jsmpp API to communicate with a SMSC (Short Message service center) which is useful for storing, forwarding, converting and delivering Short Message Service (SMS) messages. jsmpp is a java implementation of SMPP. protocol.

params.description: The behaviour when executing the given sequence.

params.description: In a clustered setup, this will run the inbound only in a single worker node.

params.description: Enable this option to suspend the inbound endpoint immediately after deployment.

params.description: IP address of the Short Message Service Center.

params.description: Port to access the Short Message Service Center.

params.description: The username to be used to connect to the Shot Message Service Center.

params.description: The password to be used to connect to the Shot Message Service Center.

params.description: The type of bind to be used to connect to the Shot Message Service Center.

params.description: Format of the addressing (bind addressing) that will be processed for inbound messages.

params.description: Numbering plan associated with the Short Message Service Center.

params.description: Identifies the type of ESME system requesting to bind as a receiver with the SMSC.

params.description: A single ESME address or a range of ESME addresses served via this SMPP receiver session.

params.name: enquireLinkTimer
params.description: Used to check the connectivity between the SMPP inbound and SMSC

params.name: transactionTimer
params.description: Time elapsed between SMPP request and the corresponding response.

params.name: reconnectInterval
params.description: The Initial retry interval to reconnect with the SMSC.

params.name: retryCount
params.description: The number of times to retry to connect with SMSC. For infinite retries, set this value to -1.

params.name: exponentialFactor
params.description: If the initial retry attempt fails, we should wait (reconnectInterval * exponentialFactor) times more.

params.name: maximumBackoffTime
params.description: The maximum backoff time to wait before retrying to connect with the SMSC.

meta.name: Twilio
meta.description: The Twilio connector allows you to connect to Twilio, an online service that lets you embed phones, VoIP, and messaging in web, desktop, and mobile software. The connector uses the Twilio REST API to connect to Twilio and work with accounts, applications, calls, messages, and more. The underlying Java classes in the connector use the Twilio Java Helper Library to make the HTTP requests to the Twilio API.

meta.name: Twitter
meta.description: The Twitter Connector allows you to work with Twitter, a social networking site where users broadcast short posts with 280 characters known as 'Tweets'. The connector uses the Twitter REST API v2.0 to work with Tweets, users, lists, and direct messages.

operations.description: Unblock User

params.name: source_user_id
params.description: The user ID who is unblocking.

params.name: target_user_id
params.description: The user ID of the user that you would like to unblock.

params.name: responseVariable
params.description: Variable name to store the response payload.

params.name: overwriteBody
params.description: Replace the current message payload with the operation response.

params.name: connectionName
params.description: The name for the Twitter connection.

params.name: apiUrl
params.description: The URL of the Twitter REST API. If not specified, defaults to https://api.twitter.com

params.name: timeout
params.description: Timeout duration of the API request in milliseconds. If not specified, defaults to 5000ms

params.name: clientId
params.description: User ID that allows you to use OAuth 2.0 as an authentication method.

params.name: clientSecret
params.description: Client secret for OAuth 2.0 authentication. Required for automatic token refresh functionality.

params.name: accessToken
params.description: Value of the Access Token to access the API via request. If not provided, will be obtained using refresh token

params.name: refreshToken
params.description: Value of the refresh token used to obtain new access tokens when the current one expires

operations.name: callWithRetry

operations.name: getAccessToken
operations.description: Get an access token by calling the Twitter refresh token endpoint.

operations.name: addDirectMessage
operations.description: Creates a Direct Message on behalf of an authenticated user, and adds it to the specified conversation.

operations.name: getDirectMessages
operations.description: Returns a list of Direct Messages for the authenticated user, both sent and received. Direct Message events are returned in reverse chronological order. Supports retrieving events from the previous 30 days.

operations.name: sendNewDirectMessage
operations.description: Sends a new direct message to the specified user from the authenticating user.

operations.name: deleteList

operations.name: getFollowingLists
operations.description: Retrieves all lists the authenticating or specified user is following, including their own.

operations.name: getListById

operations.name: getListsMemberships
operations.description: Retrieves all Lists a specified user is a member of.

operations.name: updateList
operations.description: Updates an existing list for the authenticated user.

operations.description: Retrieves information about a single user specified by the requested username.

operations.name: createRetweet
operations.description: Retweets a Tweet.

operations.name: createTweet
operations.description: Create a Tweet.

operations.name: deleteTweet
operations.description: Delete a Tweet when given the Tweet ID.

operations.name: getLikedTweetsList
operations.description: Retrieves a list of liked Tweets of the specified user ID.

operations.name: searchTweets
operations.description: Retrieves a collection of tweets that meet the specified search criteria.

operations.name: getTweetById
operations.description: Retrieves information about a single Tweet specified by the requested ID.

operations.name: getTweetsLookup
operations.description: Retrieves information about one or more Tweets specified by the requested IDs.

operations.name: getUserHomeTimeline
operations.description: Retrieves a collection of most recent Tweets and Retweets posted by you and users you follow. This endpoint can return every Tweet created on a timeline over the last 7 days as well as the most recent 800 regardless of creation date.

operations.name: getUserMentionsTimeline
operations.description: Retrieves Tweets mentioning a single user specified by the requested user ID. By default, the most recent ten Tweets are returned per request. Using pagination, up to the most recent 800 Tweets can be retrieved.

operations.name: getUserTweetsTimeline
operations.description: Retrieves Tweets composed by a single user, specified by the requested user ID. By default, the most recent ten Tweets are returned per request. Using pagination, the most recent 3,200 Tweets can be retrieved.

operations.name: likeTweet
operations.description: Allows a user to like a Tweet.

operations.name: unlikeTweet
operations.description: Allows a user to unlike a Tweet that was previously liked.

mi_connectors.name: Utility
mi_connectors.description: EI module for processing utility functions.

meta.name: Utility
meta.description: Utility connector allows you to perform utility functions on string, date, math, and signature. It has utility functions such as manipulating strings, performing math functions, working with dates, and generating and verifying payload signatures.

operations.name: sign
operations.description: Generate Signature

params.name: payload
params.description: Source of the payload to sign - either message Body or a Custom value

params.name: customPayload
params.description: The custom payload to be signed

params.name: secret
params.description: The secret key used to generate the signature

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The algorithm to use for generating the signature

params.name: targetVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the signature output should be assigned

operations.name: toLowerCase
operations.description: Transform String to Lowercase

params.name: inputString
params.description: The string to be converted to lowercase

params.name: targetVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the lowercase string will be assigned

operations.name: randomUUID
operations.description: Generate Random UUID

params.name: targetVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the generated UUID will be assigned

operations.name: getRandomInt
operations.description: Generate Random Integer

params.name: lowerBound
params.description: The minimum value (inclusive) for the random integer. Default is 0 if not specified.

params.name: upperBound
params.description: The maximum value (inclusive) for the random integer. Default is Integer.MAX_VALUE if not specified.

params.name: targetVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the generated random integer should be assigned

operations.name: toUpperCase
operations.description: Transform String to Uppercase

params.name: inputString
params.description: The string to be converted to uppercase

params.name: targetVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the uppercase string will be assigned

operations.name: length
operations.description: Get String Length

params.name: inputString
params.description: The string whose length will be calculated

params.name: targetVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the string length will be assigned

operations.name: getDate
operations.description: Get Date

params.name: format
params.description: Enter the date format. (default: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss)

params.name: targetVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the output of the operation should be assigned

operations.name: verify
operations.description: Verify Signature

params.name: payload
params.description: Source of the payload to verify - either message Body or a Custom value

params.name: customPayload
params.description: The custom payload to be verified against the signature

params.name: signature
params.description: The signature that needs to be verified against the payload

params.name: secret
params.description: The secret key used to verify the signature

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The algorithm to use for signature verification

params.name: targetVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the verification result (true/false) should be assigned

operations.name: regexMatcher
operations.description: Match Regular Expression

params.name: inputString
params.description: The string to check against the regular expression

params.name: regex
params.description: The regular expression pattern to match against the input string

params.name: targetVariable
params.description: Name of the variable to which the matching result (true/false) will be assigned
